title: Tourist bemoans lack of bears, says bears need to be trained better
text:
Tourist bemoans lack of bears, says bears need to be trained better Thursday August 27, 2015 Print Article 
It’s unclear whether the guest was speaking in jest or being completely serious. — Reddit pic CHEYENNE, Aug 27 — A visitor to the Yellowstone National Park Lodge was disappointed at not seeing any bears and left a rather unusual request on a visitor comment card. 
The comment read: “Our visit was wonderful but we never saw any bears. Please train your bears to be where guests can see them.” 
Now while the comment could be a joke, the reality is that bears not being sighted is not a good thing. Previously bears were drawn to the developed area and roadsides of the park thanks to food left out for them as well as garbage and unsecured groceries. 
The park then initiated a bear management programme in 1970 to reduce bears’ access to human food and trash. It seems the programme is working as intended, which is good for the bears and probably good for the tourists as bears are still, after all, wild animals.
